data.scheme_name: Maharashtra State Export Promotion Policy 2023 - Logistics Incentives - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides incentives for new MSME in the form of reimbursement for logistics expenditure up to 1 lakh per annum.
data.eligibility: All MSME exporting for the first time will be eligible.
data.beneficiaries: All MSME exporting for the first time will be eligible.
data.nodal_agency: Maharashtra Industry, Trade and Investment Facilitation Cell (MAITRI)
data.context: The Maharashtra State Export Promotion Policy 2023 introduced to develop every district  as an Export hub for balanced regional growth.
data.objective: The Maharashtra Export Promotion Policy 2023 aims to double the stateâ€™s exports to $150 billion by 2030, attract $3.4 billion in FDI, create 40,000 jobs, and develop 30 export-oriented infrastructure projects.
data.description: Scheme provides logistics incentives for 1st time MSME exporter reimbursement for 50% of the total logistics expenditure  limited to   1 lakh per MSME per annum for the first 3 years.
data.funding_facilitator: Maharashtra Industry, Trade and Investment Facilitation Cell (MAITRI)
data.funding_mechanism: Incentive will be released on approval of application by the concerned authority after fulfilment of condition
data.additional_info:
Zones: Group A : Denotes industrially developed areas. Group B: Denotes areas where some industrial development has taken place, but are less developed than the areas under Group A. Group C: Denotes areas, which are less developed than those covered under Group B. Group D: Denotes the lesser-developed areas of the State, not covered under Group A/ Group B/ Group C. Group D+: Denotes the least developed areas, not covered under Group A/ Group B/ Group C/ Group D. No Industry District: Denotes District having no industries viz Hingoli and Gadchiroli.

 Naxalism Affected Area: Denotes area affected by naxalism, as described in GR No NAVIKA-2008/C.R. 209/Ka. 1416 Dated 31.5.2009 (Annexure II) or as may be amended by the Government. 

Aspirational Districts: defined by Government of India viz. Washim, Gadchiroli, Osmanabad and Nandurbar.
